page.title: 09Two traditional industries.
page.content:
The traditional industries of Great Brickhill are mostly{lace-making}and {straw-plaiting.}These jobs were carried out at home and mostly by married women although the tenage girls were trained in the skills and helped their mothers. We have gained most of our information from the village census of 1861.
A{plaiter}is an old fashioned word for a plate.A straw plaiter is a girl or a woman's job. They made straw dolls and place mats.The most unusual ages for straw plaiters in Great Brickhill was 10 years old and 64 years old. If there were more than 44 straw plaiters they must have retired before the 1861 census.
